description: Gets recommendations for reservation purchases. These recommendations might help you to reduce your costs. Reservations provide a discounted hourly rate (up to 75%) compared to On-Demand pricing. Amazon Web Services generates your recommendations by identifying your On-Demand usage during a specific time period and collecting your usage into categories that are eligible for a reservation. After Amazon Web Services has these categories, it simulates every combination of reservations in each category of usage to identify the best number of each type of Reserved Instance (RI) to purchase to maximize your estimated savings. For example, Amazon Web Services automatically aggregates your Amazon EC2 Linux, shared tenancy, and c4 family usage in the US West (Oregon) Region and recommends that you buy size-flexible regional reservations to apply to the c4 family usage. Amazon Web Services recommends the smallest size instance in an instance family. This makes it easier to purchase a size-flexible Reserved Instance (RI). Amazon Web Services also shows the equal number of normalized units. This way, you can purchase any instance size that you want. For this example, your RI recommendation is for c4.large because that is the smallest size instance in the c4 instance family.

parameters.name: Service
parameters.description: The specific service that you want recommendations for.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Use Expression to filter in various Cost Explorer APIs. Not all Expression types are supported in each API. Refer to the documentation for each specific API to see what is supported. There are two patterns: Simple dimension values. There are three types of simple dimension values: CostCategories, Tags, and Dimensions. Specify the CostCategories field to define a filter that acts on Cost Categories. Specify the Tags field to define a filter that acts on Cost Allocation Tags. Specify the Dimensions field to define a filter that acts on the DimensionValues. For each filter type, you can set the dimension name and values for the filters that you plan to use. For example, you can filter for REGION==us-east-1 OR REGION==us-west-1. For GetRightsizingRecommendation, the Region is a full name (for example, REGION==US East (N. Virginia). The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] } } As shown in the previous example, lists of dimension values are combined with OR when applying the filter. You can also set different match options to further control how the filter behaves. Not all APIs support match options. For example, you can filter for linked account names that start with 'a'. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "Dimensions": { "Key": "LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME", "MatchOptions": [ "STARTS_WITH" ], "Values": [ "a" ] } } Compound Expression types with logical operations. You can use multiple Expression types and the logical operators AND/OR/NOT to create a list of one or more Expression objects. By doing this, you can filter by more advanced options. For example, you can filter by ((REGION == us-east-1 OR REGION == us-west-1) OR (TAG.Type == Type1)) AND (USAGE_TYPE != DataTransfer). The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } Or (list) --- Return results that match either Dimension object. (dict) --- Use Expression to filter in various Cost Explorer APIs. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } And (list) --- Return results that match both Dimension objects. The corresponding Expression for this example is as follows: { "And": [ {"Or": [ {"Dimensions": { "Key": "REGION", "Values": [ "us-east-1", "us-west-1" ] }}, {"Tags": { "Key": "TagName", "Values": ["Value1"] } } ]}, {"Not": {"Dimensions": { "Key": "USAGE_TYPE", "Values": ["DataTransfer"] }}} ] } Not (dict) --- Return results that don't match a Dimension object. Dimensions (dict) --- The specific Dimension to use for Expression. Key (string) --- The names of the metadata types that you can use to filter and group your results. For example, AZ returns a list of Availability Zones. Not all dimensions are supported in each API. LINKED_ACCOUNT_NAME and SERVICE_CODE can only be used in CostCategoryRule. ANOMALY_TOTAL_IMPACT_ABSOLUTE and ANOMALY_TOTAL_IMPACT_PERCENTAGE can only be used in AnomalySubscriptions. Values (list) --- The metadata values that you can use to filter and group your results. You can use GetDimensionValues to find specific values. (string) --- MatchOptions (list) --- The match options that you can use to filter your results. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to Cost Category and Anomaly Subscriptions. The default values for MatchOptions are EQUALS and CASE_SENSITIVE. (string) --- Tags (dict) --- The specific Tag to use for Expression. Key (string) --- The key for the tag. Values (list) --- The specific value of the tag. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to Cost Category. (string) --- CostCategories (dict) --- The filter that's based on CostCategory values. Key (string) --- The unique name of the Cost Category. Values (list) --- The specific value of the Cost Category. MatchOptions is only applicable for actions related to cost category. The default values for MatchOptions is EQUALS and CASE_SENSITIVE. (string) ---

parameters.name: ServiceSpecification
parameters.description: The hardware specifications for the service instances that you want recommendations for, such as standard or convertible Amazon EC2 instances. EC2Specification (dict) --- The Amazon EC2 hardware specifications that you want Amazon Web Services to provide recommendations for. OfferingClass (string) --- Indicates whether you want a recommendation for standard or convertible reservations.

nested_params.name: EC2Specification
nested_params.description: The Amazon EC2 hardware specifications that you want Amazon Web Services to provide recommendations for.

nested_params.name: OfferingClass
nested_params.description: Indicates whether you want a recommendation for standard or convertible reservations.

nested_items.name: RecommendationId
nested_items.description: The ID for the recommendation.

nested_items.name: GenerationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The timestamp for when Amazon Web Services made the recommendation.

nested_items.name: AdditionalMetadata
nested_items.description: Additional metadata that might be applicable to the recommendation.

nested_items.name: Recommendations
nested_items.description: Recommendations for reservations to purchase.

nested_items.name: AccountScope
nested_items.description: The account scope that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase this instance for. For example, you can purchase this reservation for an entire organization in Amazon Web Services Organizations.

nested_items.name: LookbackPeriodInDays
nested_items.description: How many days of previous usage that Amazon Web Services considers when making this recommendation.

nested_items.name: TermInYears
nested_items.description: The term of the reservation that you want recommendations for, in years.

nested_items.name: PaymentOption
nested_items.description: The payment option for the reservation (for example, AllUpfront or NoUpfront).

nested_items.name: ServiceSpecification
nested_items.description: Hardware specifications for the service that you want recommendations for.

nested_items.name: EC2Specification
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 hardware specifications that you want Amazon Web Services to provide recommendations for.

nested_items.name: OfferingClass
nested_items.description: Indicates whether you want a recommendation for standard or convertible reservations.

nested_items.name: RecommendationDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the recommended purchases.

nested_items.name: AccountId
nested_items.description: The account that this Reserved Instance (RI) recommendation is for.

nested_items.name: InstanceDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the reservations that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: EC2InstanceDetails
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 reservations that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: Family
nested_items.description: The instance family of the recommended reservation.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The type of instance that Amazon Web Services recommends.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the recommended reservation.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The platform of the recommended reservation. The platform is the specific combination of operating system, license model, and software on an instance.

nested_items.name: Tenancy
nested_items.description: Determines whether the recommended reservation is dedicated or shared.

nested_items.name: CurrentGeneration
nested_items.description: Determines whether the recommendation is for a current-generation instance.

nested_items.name: SizeFlexEligible
nested_items.description: Determines whether the recommended reservation is size flexible.

nested_items.description: The database engine that the recommended reservation supports.

nested_items.name: DatabaseEdition
nested_items.description: The database edition that the recommended reservation supports.

nested_items.name: DeploymentOption
nested_items.description: Determines whether the recommendation is for a reservation in a single Availability Zone or a reservation with a backup in a second Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model that the recommended reservation supports.

nested_items.name: RecommendedNumberOfInstancesToPurchase
nested_items.description: The number of instances that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: RecommendedNormalizedUnitsToPurchase
nested_items.description: The number of normalized units that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: MinimumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The minimum number of instances that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: MinimumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The minimum number of normalized units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: MaximumNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The maximum number of instances that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: MaximumNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The maximum number of normalized units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: AverageNumberOfInstancesUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The average number of instances that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: AverageNormalizedUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The average number of normalized units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: AverageUtilization
nested_items.description: The average utilization of your instances. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: EstimatedBreakEvenInMonths
nested_items.description: How long Amazon Web Services estimates that it takes for this instance to start saving you money, in months.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code that Amazon Web Services used to calculate the costs for this instance.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlySavingsAmount
nested_items.description: How much Amazon Web Services estimates that this specific recommendation might save you in a month.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlySavingsPercentage
nested_items.description: How much Amazon Web Services estimates that this specific recommendation might save you in a month, as a percentage of your overall costs.

nested_items.name: EstimatedMonthlyOnDemandCost
nested_items.description: How much Amazon Web Services estimates that you spend on On-Demand Instances in a month.

nested_items.name: EstimatedReservationCostForLookbackPeriod
nested_items.description: How much Amazon Web Services estimates that you might spend for all usage during the specified historical period if you had a reservation.

nested_items.name: UpfrontCost
nested_items.description: How much purchasing this instance costs you upfront.

nested_items.name: RecurringStandardMonthlyCost
nested_items.description: How much purchasing this instance costs you on a monthly basis.

nested_items.name: ReservedCapacityDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the reservations that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: DynamoDBCapacityDetails
nested_items.description: The DynamoDB reservations that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: CapacityUnits
nested_items.description: The capacity unit of the recommended reservation.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the recommended reservation.

nested_items.name: RecommendedNumberOfCapacityUnitsToPurchase
nested_items.description: The number of reserved capacity units that Amazon Web Services recommends that you purchase.

nested_items.name: MinimumNumberOfCapacityUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The minimum number of provisioned capacity units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: MaximumNumberOfCapacityUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The maximum number of provisioned capacity units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: AverageNumberOfCapacityUnitsUsedPerHour
nested_items.description: The average number of provisioned capacity units that you used in an hour during the historical period. Amazon Web Services uses this to calculate your recommended reservation purchases.

nested_items.name: RecommendationSummary
nested_items.description: A summary about the recommended purchase.

nested_items.name: TotalEstimatedMonthlySavingsAmount
nested_items.description: The total amount that Amazon Web Services estimates that this recommendation could save you in a month.

nested_items.name: TotalEstimatedMonthlySavingsPercentage
nested_items.description: The total amount that Amazon Web Services estimates that this recommendation could save you in a month, as a percentage of your costs.

nested_items.name: CurrencyCode
nested_items.description: The currency code used for this recommendation.

nested_items.name: NextPageToken
nested_items.description: The pagination token for the next set of retrievable results.
